concept.title: May 18, 2017
concept.shortdesc: Release Notes for the May 18, 2017 release.

row.entry: Fixed a bug that capped the first page of Library results to 10 assets.
Fixed a bug to allow keywords to be edited after saving a rule.
Fixed a bug in Storify 2’s Editor to make Twitter hashtag searches return consistent results.
Fixed a bug in Studio 1’s Facebook Curate rules to pull in all public results when doing a hashtag search.
Updated the ncomments API so that requests are sent over https.
Fixed a bug in Carousel to allow native Livefyre content (images uploaded directly to Studio) to appear in the app appropriately.
Enhanced Comments to meet font color guidelines dictated by ADA requirements.
Enhanced App Content to allow users to download raw video files for videos uploaded via the Upload Button.
Fixed a bug that prevented map locations from saving when performing Twitter Social Searches.
Fixed a bug in Storify 2 that was causing the page to jump if a user sorted by “Oldest to Newest” or “Newest to Oldest”.

Updated the sorting labels in Storify 2 to match the expected behavior. “Oldest to newest” and “Newest to oldest” will now say “First to last” and “Last to first”. The sort order is based on the order dictated in Storify 2’s Editor, not publish date.
Added the ability to filter Tweets by Language in Stream Rules.
Fixed a bug to allow all uploaded media in tweets to be captured by the Media Required filter.
Added the ability to filter on multiple map locations in Twitter and Instagram Stream rules.
Added validation improvements when saving Twitter Stream Rules.
